title: English Word Families
description: Develop foundational phonics skills through word families for Class 1 students.

subtopics.title: Word Families 1
subtopics.content:
## Word Families

A word family is a group of words that have the same ending sound. Examples include:

- **-an family**: can, fan, man, pan, van
- **-at family**: bat, cat, hat, mat, rat
- **-en family**: den, hen, men, pen, ten
- **-et family**: jet, met, net, pet, wet

Words in the same family sound alike at the end and rhyme.
subtopics.codeExample:
### Understanding Word Families:
- What is a word family?
- Name words from the -at family.
- Say words from the -an family aloud.

### Practice:
- Identify words from given families
- Match words to their word family
- Complete word family charts

subtopics.title: More Word Families
subtopics.content:
## More Word Families

Learn new word families that rhyme:

- **-ack family**: back, pack, rack, sack
- **-ain family**: rain, main, pain, gain
- **-ake family**: bake, lake, make, take
- **-ale family**: male, pale, tale, sale
- **-all family**: ball, hall, tall, wall
- **-ame family**: name, game, same, tame

Practice clapping, stamping, or shouting to remember each family's sound.
subtopics.codeExample:
### Word Family Questions:
- Which words belong to the -ake family?
- What sound does the -all family make?
- Name two words from the -ame family.

### Practice:
- Sort words into correct families
- Complete rhyming patterns
- Play word family games
